marketNews.title: DEWA 1H25 Earnings Call: Prospect of Operational Performance Improvement in 2H25
marketNews.content:
Darma Henwa (DEWA) management held a 1H25 earnings call on Wednesday (6/8) afternoon. Here are our key notes:

2Q25 Operational Performance Declined Due to High Rainfall
The decline in DEWA's revenue by -3.8% QoQ in 2Q25 was caused by a decrease in total material moved due to higher rainfall. Operationally, DEWA in 2Q25 recorded overburden volume of 33.4 million bcm (-4% QoQ) and coal production of 4.2 million tons (-0% QoQ), resulting in total material moved declining by -4% QoQ to 36.6 million bcm.

2H25 Guidance: EBITDA Margin Has Potential to Continue Growing Along with New Equipment Operation
DEWA management stated that the second batch of heavy equipment is already in the mining area and is currently being assembled. A total of 3 sets of heavy equipment are expected to start operating in early September 2025, with the rest operating in October 2025. This has the potential to increase the company's EBITDA margin in the coming quarters.
DEWA management expects internal overburden volume in 3Q25 to rise to 19.98 million bcm (+47.1% QoQ from the 2Q25 realization of 13.58 million bcm) and 23.54 million bcm in 4Q25 (+17.8% QoQ from the 3Q25 expectation). However, DEWA management also stated that they plan to carry out impairment on fixed assets and inventory in 3Q25.

Plans to Write Off Accumulated Loss Deficit
DEWA will hold an Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (EGMS) on September 10, 2025, to seek shareholder approval to write off the negative retained earnings balance. DEWA will adjust the retained earnings account with the foreign currency translation adjustment account.

Update on Gayo Mineral Resources
DEWA management announced that the company is prioritizing exploration on 2 out of 8 pits at Gayo Mineral Resources and plans to announce them gradually after JORC in 2027.

Key Takeaway
Although newly meeting 47% of Stockbit's 2025F estimate, we assess that DEWA is still able to achieve our EBITDA expectation of IDR 1.7 trillion along with: 1) the realization of the EBITDA margin in 2Q25 at 27.8% has exceeded our 2025F expectation of 27%, as well as the potential for EBITDA margin increase in 2H25 alongside the addition of heavy equipment capacity; and 2) revenue has the potential to improve in 2H25 in line with better weather projections. However, from the net profit aspect, we see DEWA is at risk of not reaching our 2025F estimate due to the impairment plan the company intends to execute.

marketNews.title: Other hot things you need to know...
marketNews.content:
1. The Minister of Investment and Downstreaming, Rosan Roeslani, claimed that the US will provide a 0% tariff for copper products originating from Indonesia, although he did not elaborate further. President Trump himself last week did exclude several copper products - for example, refined copper products - from the 50% tariff for copper commodities. Besides copper, Rosan claimed that the government has requested the US to grant tariff reductions for several other commodities, including nickel.
2. US President Donald Trump on Wednesday (6/8) imposed an additional 25% tariff on goods originating from India, following India's continued purchase of Russian energy. This additional tariff means goods from India will be subject to a total tariff of 50% by the US. The additional tariff for India will take effect within 21 days from the date Trump's order was issued on Wednesday (6/8). Trump's move was taken after the US failed to reach an agreement with Russia to end the war in Ukraine.
3. China Customs noted that China's exports in July 2025 grew by +7.2% YoY to US$321.8 billion (vs. June 2025: +5.85% YoY), exceeding the consensus expectation of +5.4% YoY and marking the highest export growth since April 2025. This result was driven by export growth to the European Union, Southeast Asia, Australia, Hong Kong, and other markets, which could offset the trend of double-digit export decline to the US for 4 consecutive months.
4. Brazilian company Suzano SA on Wednesday (6/8) announced it will cut pulp production by 3.5% or approximately 450,000 tons in the next 12 months. This step was taken after negotiations with clients in China - its largest market - were hampered by uncertainty over tariffs from US President Donald Trump. Suzano CEO, Joao Alberto Abreu, stated that negotiations regarding pulp prices were hampered by political uncertainty, especially amid expectations of increased supply to China due to reduced supply to the US. Although pulp is excluded from the 50% tariff imposed by the US on goods from Brazil, Abreu mentioned that uncertainty still significantly affects trade.
5. Bank Indonesia noted that Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves at the end of July 2025 decreased to USD 152 billion (vs. June 2025: USD 152.6 billion). This development was influenced by government foreign debt payments and the stabilization policy for the Rupiah exchange rate. The position of foreign exchange reserves at the end of July 2025 is equivalent to financing 6.3 months of imports or 6.2 months of imports and government foreign debt payments.

marketNews.title: About MSCI, Speculation, and the Poker Table in Investment
marketNews.content: "The card that you feel is good but fails to win the game, which tends to make you lose big, is what leads to bankruptcy." - thowilz

tickerNews.title: BRMS Upgrades Gold Production Volume Projection for 2028-2029
tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources Minerals Director, Herwin Wahyu Hidayat, said that the company projects production volume in 2028 and 2029 could reach more than 160,000 troy ounces and more than 230,000 troy ounces, respectively. This projection is higher than the previous estimate in June 2025, where the company projected production volume in both years to reach 150,000 troy ounces and 200,000 troy ounces, respectively. Herwin also added that during the 2024-2027 period, BRMS gold production volume will range between 64,000-90,000 troy ounces per year (compared to the 2024 realization: 64,983 troy ounces).

tickerNews.title: GOOD Achieves Framework Agreement for Cooperation with Bel S.A. to Develop KEJU's Cheese Business
tickerNews.content: Garudafood Putra Putri Jaya (GOOD) announced that the company has reached a framework agreement to cooperate with the French company, Bel S.A. In this cooperation, Bel S.A. and GOOD will jointly control Mulia Boga Raya. The transaction value has not been announced, while this corporate action is aimed at developing the cheese business run by KEJU.

tickerNews.title: PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara Sells 606 Million DEWA Shares
tickerNews.content: Darma Henwa shareholders, PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara, sold 606 million DEWA shares at an average price of 75 rupiah per share on August 4, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 45.5 billion. Following this transaction, PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara's ownership in DEWA decreased from 21.07% to 19.58%.

tickerNews.title: Two SSIA Directors Sold a Total of ~6.1 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: Two directors of Surya Semesta Internusa, The Jok Tung and Wilson Effendy, sold a total of approximately 6.1 million SSIA shares at an average price of approximately 2,637 rupiah per share on July 31-August 1, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 16 billion. After these transactions, The Jok Tung's ownership in SSIA decreased from 0.17% to 0.05%, while Wilson Effendy's decreased from 0.06% to 0.05%.

tickerNews.title: Eight AKRA Directors and Commissioners Purchased 28.2 Million Shares as Part of MESOP Execution
tickerNews.content: Eight directors and commissioners of AKR Corporindo purchased a total of 28.2 million AKRA shares at an average price of 499 rupiah per share on August 1, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 14.1 billion. These transactions are part of the implementation of the MESOP (Management and Employee Stock Ownership Plan).
